title: Generic Drugs Market Forecast to Reach USD 615.72 Billion by 2030
text:
Generic Drugs Market Forecast to Reach USD 615.72 Billion by 2030 01-10-2025 06:32 AM CET | Advertising, Media Consulting, Marketing Research
Press release from: Maximize Market Research Pvt. Ltd. Generic Drugs Market

The global generic drugs market is on a robust growth trajectory, with projections indicating a rise from USD 431.15 billion in 2023 to approximately USD 615.72 billion by 2030, reflecting a compound annual growth rate (CAGR) of 5.22% during the forecast period.

Several factors are propelling this growth:

The generic drugs market is witnessing varied growth patterns and strategic developments across different regions:

Vietnam's pharmaceutical market is expanding, with a notable increase in the adoption of generic drugs. The government's efforts to enhance healthcare access and affordability have led to policies favoring generic medications, creating significant opportunities for market players.
ð™‚ð™šð™£ð™šð™§ð™žð™˜ ð˜¿ð™§ð™ªð™œð™¨ ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™‚ð™§ð™¤ð™¬ð™©ð™ ð™žð™£ ð™ð™ð™–ð™žð™¡ð™–ð™£ð™™
Thailand's healthcare system is experiencing a shift towards generic drugs, driven by initiatives to reduce healthcare costs and improve patient access to essential medicines. The Thai government's support for generic drug use is fostering market growth.
ð™‚ð™šð™£ð™šð™§ð™žð™˜ ð˜¿ð™§ð™ªð™œð™¨ ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™ð™§ð™šð™£ð™™ð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð™…ð™–ð™¥ð™–ð™£
Japan has been actively promoting the use of generic drugs to curb healthcare spending. The government's target to increase the generic drug utilization rate has led to a surge in generic drug prescriptions, indicating a positive trend in the market.

South Korea's generic drugs market is witnessing consolidation, with mergers and acquisitions among local pharmaceutical companies aiming to enhance competitiveness and expand product portfolios. This trend is expected to strengthen the market's growth prospects.
ð™‚ð™šð™£ð™šð™§ð™žð™˜ ð˜¿ð™§ð™ªð™œð™¨ ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™ð™¥ð™™ð™–ð™©ð™žð™¤ð™£ ð™žð™£ ð™Žð™žð™£ð™œð™–ð™¥ð™¤ð™§ð™š
Singapore is updating its regulatory framework to streamline the approval process for generic drugs, encouraging market entry and competition. These regulatory enhancements are anticipated to boost the availability of generic medications in the country.

The U.S. generic drugs market remains robust, with significant contributions to healthcare cost savings. The high adoption rate of generic medications continues to drive market growth, supported by a favorable regulatory environment.
ð™‚ð™šð™£ð™šð™§ð™žð™˜ ð˜¿ð™§ð™ªð™œð™¨ ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™ð™§ð™šð™£ð™™ð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð˜¾ð™ð™žð™£ð™–
China's generic drugs market is expanding rapidly, driven by healthcare reforms and policies promoting the use of generics to make healthcare more affordable. The government's emphasis on generic drug quality and consistency is fostering market confidence and growth.
ð™‚ð™šð™£ð™šð™§ð™žð™˜ ð˜¿ð™§ð™ªð™œð™¨ ð™ˆð™–ð™§ð™ ð™šð™© ð™Šð™¥ð™¥ð™¤ð™§ð™©ð™ªð™£ð™žð™©ð™žð™šð™¨ ð™žð™£ ð™€ð™ªð™§ð™¤ð™¥ð™š
Europe presents substantial opportunities for the generic drugs market, with increasing acceptance and integration of generic medications into healthcare systems. Efforts to harmonize regulations across the European Union are facilitating market expansion and accessibility.

The generic drugs industry has witnessed significant mergers and acquisitions aimed at enhancing market reach and product offerings. For instance, in recent years, major pharmaceutical companies have engaged in strategic partnerships to strengthen their positions in the global market.

ð†ðžð§ðžð«ð¢ðœ ðƒð«ð®ð ð¬ ðŒðšð«ð¤ðžð­ ð’ðžð ð¦ðžð§ð­ ð€ð§ðšð¥ð²ð¬ð¢ð¬:
ð›ð² ðð«ð¨ðð®ðœð­
Simple Generics
Super Generics
Biosimilars
The global generic drug industry is divided into three segments based on the product: biosimilars, super generics, and simple generics. In 2023, the Super Generics category had the biggest market share, with about 38%. Super generic medications are referred to as value enhanced generics, hybrids, and unique therapeutic entities. Super generic products are not the same as the original product in terms of composition or distribution method. Although biosimilars can only be as comparable to the original branded drug as validation technology allows, they have the same clinical impact as generics. As biosimilar developers concentrate on increasingly complicated proteins that require more expensive and advanced production processes, they will be pressured to follow established methods for demonstrating a high degree of similarity.
ð›ð² ð€ð©ð©ð¥ð¢ðœðšð­ð¢ð¨ð§
Cardiovascular Products
Anti-Infective Drugs
Anti-Arthritis Drugs
Central Nervous System Drugs
Anti-Cancer Drug
Respiratory Products
Others
Cardiovascular Products, Anti-Infective Drugs, Anti-Arthritis Drugs, Central Nervous System Drugs, Anti-Cancer Drugs, Respiratory Products, and Others are the sub-segments of the worldwide generic drug market based on application. In 2023, the biggest market share was held by the Central Nervous System Drugs sector. Access to better healthcare options, societal acceptance of people with mental illnesses, and growing knowledge of mental health issues are some of the key factors predicted to propel market expansion. The expansion of the generic medication market is anticipated to be driven by affordable and easily accessible pharmaceuticals during the forecast period.
